title: My PC shuts down because I overclocked cpu
body:
My PC shuts down because I overclocked cpu.My temps are oke not over 50 while i play other games but when i start lol and im in chemp select pc just shuts down.I have AMD 8350 overclocked 4.5ghz i dont see reason of shot downing.can somebody help?or somebody have same problem like me.
Pc specs:
AMD 8350 4.5ghz overclocked
Sapphire r9 380x 
Kingston hyperX 1866hz
1. hdd 1tb
{{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}}

replies.body: Guys its just shuting down when i have client on not while im in game or something like that im playing gta v 1080p ultra settings easy 60fps stable im playing csgo 1080p stable im playing lol in 1080p stable but only when im picking champions pc shuts down i dont see reason and taht started 3 days ago i have cooler master hyper 412s i took voltages just littlebit up from 1.368 to 1.4 nothing to big but maybe lol dont support oc or something like that i dont have a lot of experience of oc but this is not some thing extreme

Not all games/programs/applications are the same in the way that they utilize your hardware. Its therefore possible for your oc settings to be stable in certain situations are not in others.
Example I OC'd my graphics are a couple months ago, settings were stable in most games but would randomly crash sometimes in Heroes of the Storm.

Id recommend you google overclocking guides for your specific CPU. Keep in mind that with regards to overclocking, different batches of the same chips will OC differently. The quality of each chip is not the same, some OC better than others, its ultimately a lottery and you can get a good or bad chip. You therefore need to thoroughly test what settings work for your specific cpu and not just randomly assign clock speed and voltage.

If you dont have it already id recommend downloading CPUID HWMonitor and monitor the temps of your CPU at load.

Ultimately you should try lowering your clock to 4.4 and the voltage by a bit and seeing if this fixes your problems.

Easy fix...revert the overclock to normal settings and read up some more on how to OC correctly. While 50c isn't to high that doesn't mean that the OC is stable. Starting from factory increase the clock speeds .1ghz and just prime95 for awhile, if it doesn't crash raise it another .1ghz. Repeat until it crashes. Then if you want you can try and raise the voltage a little bit and do the whole thing over again. DO NOT RAISE THE VOLTAGE IF YOU HAVE STOCK COOLER!!!!! On that note because he didn't mention the cooling setup you have, if you only have a stock CPU cooler you aren't really going to be able to overclock that much.

What are your OC settings? How many Volts are you pumping into your CPU? What is your CPU cooling solution? And what other games have you tested?

Additionally, other, newer games are likely not as dependant on the CPU. I suspect, given how the LoL client is looking and feeling, that this game is more CPU dependant than others. But even so, a PC shouldn't just shut down unless A) it's overheating, or B) your OC is unstable at load.

http://www.tomshardware.co.uk/answers/id-2207262/safe-voltage-amd-8350-5ghz.html
http://www.overclock.net/t/1318995/official-fx-8320-fx-8350-vishera-owners-club

I tried some OCing on my previous CPU, an Intel Core-2 Quad Extreme QX9650, but while it took a ~33% OC (from 3.0 to 4.0 GHz), it wasn't stable then. Under CPU load, my PC also shut down. So the OC was reduced to 3.8 GHz, and was tested stable at that speed (but with a 7°C increase on the cores).

Are you experienced in overclocking? Did you test proper voltages for that OC because it sounds like it might not be stable.

Try increasing the voltage assuming its within the safe limits for that CPU, otherwise lower your OC until its stable.

When a computer instantly shuts down instantly, it usually is a result of overheating.  I know you said that your computer does not reach over 50, but something definitely doesn't seem to be working normally.  The best step you can take at this moment is to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  One of our Tech Specialists can work with you one-on-one in order to get this resolved.  If you do submit a ticket, make sure to include the following:

1) [DxDiag](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5)

2) [Your latest R3d Log (check the date!)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq7)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)
